main.name: Gary Ng
main.description: I'm a Indianapolis/Remote based Full Stack Engineer with over 5 years of experience who loves building things and solving problems. My expertise is building backend services with REST or Lambda.
main.bio: When I'm not coding, you can usually find me playing table tennis, gaming, cooking, working with cars or taking pictures. My current goal in Table Tennis is to reach a rating of over 1800.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to leave me a message.

resume.skillmessage: Self-motivated problem solving software developer. Experience in developing full stack applications. Skilled in developing & debugging cloud applications(AWS)

descriptions.description: Designing & developing a highly scalable dealer web application with Spring Boot and Angular
Strong understanding of common API technologies, such as OAUTH, Spring Boot and Microservices
Contributed to the DevOps to automate the build and deployment process using Jenkins, Tekton, shell scripting
Used Angular as framework to create a Single Page application which can bin data to specific views and synchronize data with server
Involved in the design and development phase of Agile Software Development
Created and maintained clear, concise project plans and developed strategies to meet deadlines
Develop design documents, user guides, maintenance documents, project documentation, and release documents
Write efficient, maintainable and reusable code prioritizing privacy and security
Write JSP and Servlets to add functionality to web application based on customer requirements
Modernize legacy system to AWS services, reducing operating costs and improving functionality
Completed full redesigns of existing websites with ClojureScript
Wrote efficient, maintainable and reusable code prioritizing privacy and security
Worked with team members to design and develop robust solutions to meet client requirements
Monitored and tested application performance to identify potential bottlenecks, develop solutions
Built and deployed CI/CD pipelines on MS Azure with automation test
Attended Community of Practice meetings and training seminars every two weeks
